column3: str
Oh, why does nobody want to buy my lovely treasures? And why is my tummy rumbling so? Running a shop of your own sure is tough! However does Rowena manage?
Welcome, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Here to help me do Menphina's work, I take it? Let's see how many smiles we can put on the children's faces today!
Welcome back, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I'm happy to say that the children are smiling more and more with each passing day!

Oh, it's <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Zhloe's on the verge of making the biggest deal of her life! I <Emphasis>will</Emphasis> succeed. I <Emphasis>must</Emphasis>! For the children!
Oh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Thanks to you, the children are as happy as Zhloe's ever seen them! If only you could see their beaming faces!
Welcome home, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! I know this isn't <Emphasis>really</Emphasis> your home, but we've been working together so much lately, you feel like family!
Hello there, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Zhloe has to say, working with you has been one delightful discovery after the next! What wonders await us today?

Welcome, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Working together like this, I feel like I'm getting to know you more and more each day. I hope you're enjoying getting to know me, too!
So good to see you again, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! With the two of us working together, it won't be long until there's a smile on the face of every child in the realm!
What would you like to do?
Make a delivery (<Value>IntegerParameter(2)</Value> remaining).
Learn about custom deliveries.
Nothing.
Cast glamour on Zhloe Aliapoh.
What would you learn more about?
Satisfaction level.
Delivery requirements and rewards.
Procuring collectables.
Acquiring materials.
Increasing the value of crafted collectables.
Increasing the value of gathered collectables.
Increasing the value of fish.
Nothing.
With each successful delivery, Zhloe will come to trust you more and more, leading her to task you with assignments of greater importance.

This will be displayed in the form of a gauge atop the Custom Deliveries list. Fill this gauge to the maximum, and Zhloe's <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>satisfaction level<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>─as represented by little golden hearts─will increase.

Upon reaching a new <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>satisfaction level<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>, you will have the opportunity to learn more about Zhloe and the children in her charge.
In order to deliver an item, you must be its corresponding class and level 55 or above.
If you are level 79 or below, you will be awarded experience points instead of white scrips.
Should you find yourself unsure as to how to procure a particular item, subcommands and item descriptions can point you in the right direction.

For Disciple of the Hand items, choosing the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Search for Item by Crafting Method<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> subcommand with the list selected will bring up the crafting log and the recipe for the item in question.

Likewise, for Disciple of the Land items, choosing the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Search for Item by Gathering Method<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> subcommand will bring up the gathering log.
For knowledge on fish and fishing holes, refer to the item descriptions displayed when the list is selected.

The items sought by Zhloe fall into three categories: crafted items (obtainable by Disciples of the Hand), gathered items (obtainable by Disciples of the Land), and fish. Furthermore, Zhloe deals only in <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>collectables<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
Materials necessary to craft the collectables Zhloe seeks may be purchased from the material supplier in Idyllshire's Freewalks Roundspot.
The collectability of crafted items is directly related to its quality. Spare no effort in ensuring that the items you craft are of the highest possible quality, and you will be rewarded accordingly.

The <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Inner Quiet<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> action will serve you particularly well in synthesizing items of the utmost quality.

Begin by executing <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Inner Quiet<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>, while taking care that your CP and item durability are sufficient to finish the job.

From there, you can employ actions affecting control, then put the final flourish on your masterpiece with <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Byregot's Blessing<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.

There are a host of other actions that can serve to further enhance the quality of items you craft. Once you've mastered the fundamentals, you are encouraged to experiment with varied approaches until you find your preferred crafting approach.

The collectability of gathered items directly corresponds to their rarity. You can procure items of greater rarity by using <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Collector's Glove<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> prior to gathering.

Another effective technique is to use <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Discerning Eye<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> followed by <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Methodical Appraisal<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>. Try executing this combination three times, while taking care not to inflict too much <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>wear<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> on the item.

<UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Utmost Caution<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> will also serve you well in gathering items of greater rarity. At times when you seek quantity over quality, <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Single Mind<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> may prove useful.

Should you still find the rarity of your gathered items lacking despite your best efforts, you are encouraged to outfit yourself with new gear to increase your <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>perception<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> and <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>GP<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
The collectability value of fish follows a simple rule─the bigger, the better.

Upon arriving at the fishing hole where your desired quarry resides, use the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Collect<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> action, then begin fishing.

From there, using <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Patience II<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> followed by effective hooking actions will increase your chances of reeling in a big one.

Should you still find yourself catching only small fry, try outfitting yourself with better equipment to raise your <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>perception<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.

The items sought by Zhloe fall into three categories: crafted items (obtainable by Disciples of the Hand), gathered items (obtainable by Disciples of the Land), and fish. Furthermore, Zhloe deals only in <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>collectables<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
In order to deliver an item, you must be its corresponding class and level 55 or above.
If you are level 79 or below, you will be awarded experience points instead of white scrips.
Information on how to find individual items may be found in the following manner.

For Disciple of the Hand items, choosing the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Search for Item by Crafting Method<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> subcommand with the list selected will bring up the crafting log and the relevant recipes.
Materials necessary to craft these items may be purchased from the material supplier in Idyllshire's Freewalks Roundspot.

For Disciple of the Land items, choosing the <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Search for Item by Gathering Method<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> subcommand will bring up the gathering log and the recipes in question.
For information on fish and fishing holes, refer to the item descriptions displayed within the list itself.
The higher an item's collectability, the greater the reward you will earn from Zhloe upon successful delivery.

To learn more about collectables and how to increase collectability, speak with Zhloe Aliapoh and select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Learn about custom deliveries<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
In making your first successful delivery, you have begun to earn Zhloe's trust.

With each successful delivery, Zhloe will grow more and more satisfied with your efforts. Fill the gauge completely and Zhloe's <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>satisfaction level<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> will increase, giving you the opportunity to learn more about your business partner.
You can make up to six deliveries in a given week. Deliver the items Zhloe needs, and deliver them often to win the trust and praise of your new business partner!

You have reached the weekly limit for deliveries. You may begin again starting <ResetTime>1203</ResetTime><Switch(TopLevelParameter(220))><Case(1)>Sunday</Case><Case(2)>Monday</Case><Case(3)>Tuesday</Case><Case(4)>Wednesday</Case><Case(5)>Thursday</Case><Case(6)>Friday</Case><Case(7)>Saturday</Case></Switch> at <If(TopLevelParameter(218))><Switch(TopLevelParameter(218))><Case(1)>1</Case><Case(2)>2</Case><Case(3)>3</Case><Case(4)>4</Case><Case(5)>5</Case><Case(6)>6</Case><Case(7)>7</Case><Case(8)>8</Case><Case(9)>9</Case><Case(10)>10</Case><Case(11)>11</Case><Case(12)>12</Case><Case(13)>1</Case><Case(14)>2</Case><Case(15)>3</Case><Case(16)>4</Case><Case(17)>5</Case><Case(18)>6</Case><Case(19)>7</Case><Case(20)>8</Case><Case(21)>9</Case><Case(22)>10</Case><Case(23)>11</Case></Switch><Else/>12</If> <If(GreaterThanOrEqualTo(TopLevelParameter(218),12))>p.m.<Else/>a.m.</If> (Earth time).
With Ishgardians taking a greater and greater interest in foreign nations of late, trinkets and treasures from the Near East are in great demand. This is just what they're looking for!
The Coerthas highlands are home to all sorts of treasures of cool, austere beauty. The wealthy patrons of Costa del Sol are sure to pay a good price for something this exotic and enticing!
Weaponry, alchemical potations, rations...the Admiral needs all the supplies she can get, and this should serve quite nicely!
A present for the children? How kind of you! The mere sight of the box is sure to fill their hearts with joy and wonder. Why, I suppose it will have the same effect on me!
More supplies for the orphanage? Zhloe can't thank you enough. Anything you can offer for us is truly, deeply appreciated─by me and the children both!

This is a form of ancient currency once minted in Radz–at–Han, said to be a remnant of ancient trade routes long since abandoned. It's sure to strike the fancy of any connoisseur of Near Eastern history.

Ice stalagmites, formed by the dripping of pure cavern waters over long periods of time, are known for their crystal-clear purity. Speaking of which, what's the difference between a stalagmite and a stalactite again? Either way, this is sure to fetch a good price!

This moss is an indispensable ingredient in the brewing of dusken draught, which, as we all know, is <Emphasis>itself</Emphasis> indispensable in...actually, I'm not quite sure. What I <Emphasis>am</Emphasis> sure about is that the Maelstrom's supplier is willing to pay a premium for it!

If it's one thing the children love, it's playing with these little glass balls! When I was struggling to put food on their plates, sometimes they would try to swallow them─that wasn't good. But I'm certain that's a thing of the past now!
With these seven striking colors, the children will be able to paint anything their little heart's desire! Wouldn't it be sweet if one of them decided to paint a portrait of you or me?

Isn't this one so beautiful? It's said they were originally bred by the Sharlayans for research purposes, then released into the sea─by accident or design, none can say. I must say, it looks quite tasty as well!
So elegant and limpid, you'd think it was fashioned from solid ice. This is sure to fetch a princely sum from Master Gegeruju!
Another key ingredient of dusken draught, red coral is said to be in short supply around La Noscea of late. Fortunately for us, there's plenty to be found high in the skies!
T'kebbe and her friends love these little beauties. By putting two of them together, look─you can even make a little heart!

Fried river shrimp are the children's favorite supper treat! Raw, boiled and buttered...but especially fried! I'm quite partial to them myself─it's all I can do to keep myself from eating their share!

Now, let's take a closer look! Oh, well...this is certainly, um, nice. Yes, I'm sure that someone...somewhere...would take a liking to this. Sometimes, it's the imperfections that give something extra charm. Like how Zhloe's one crooked tooth makes her that much cuter, you know? Just like that!
Now, let's take a closer look... Why, this is lovely! My customers will be overjoyed to see something so beautiful! I can't thank you enough, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>!

Now, let's take a closer look... Oh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, it's absolutely stunning! So stunning that it's a shame I have to sell it! But I will make the ultimate sacrifice─for the children!
Let's take a look, now... A present for the children? How terribly thoughtful of you! Thanks to you, this will be one of the happiest days of their lives. I'm sure of it!
Let's see what we have here... More supplies for the orphanage? Oh, thank you ever so much, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Zhloe promises she'll put it to good use!
Unable to obtain your reward. Your inventory is full.
To collect your reward, make room in your inventory and speak with Zhloe Aliapoh once more.

Thanks to you, I've got so many Near Eastern treasures that I barely have space for them all! Fortunately, Zhloe knows some very wealthy individuals who can hardly wait to take them off her hands. Tee hee!
Thanks to your hard work, Zhloe's practically swimming in souvenirs from the highlands! Why, I can just see the smile on Master Gegeruju's face...and the gil flowing freely from his coffers. Tee hee!

Zhloe is ever, ever so grateful to you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Thanks to you, the Maelstrom will have enough materiel to wage a thousand wars! I can just hear the sound of the cannons a-firing and hulls a-cracking! Did I mention that I wanted to be a pirate when I was small?

Oh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, how can Zhloe ever thank you? So many gifts, and every last one of them straight from the heart! The children will know joy and happiness beyond their wildest dreams!
I'm happy to say that your Near Eastern treasures have found no end of fans among the Ishgardian aristocracy!
Why, with only the funds that have poured in thus far, I can safely say that Menphina's Arms will stay welcomingly wide open for...well, at least the next couple of days or so!

But is Zhloe going to rest on her laurels? Perish the thought! Not when there are countless children still yearning for warmth and love! I can count on you...can't I, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>?
Oh, thank you! This calls for a celebration! Why, yes, I think I'll treat myself to that last bite of pineapple pudding I've been saving since last week!
If anyone deserves it, it's you, Miss Zhloe! You're always working so hard to put food on our plates.
Hello, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady<Else/>mister</If>. Who are you?
This is <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, a famous adventurer. <If(PlayerParameter(4))>She's<Else/>He's</If> the one who's helping Miss Zhloe turn her trading business around!
You're an adventurer, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Miss<Else/>Mister</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? My mummy and daddy are adventurers, too! I wish you could meet them...
Mummy and Daddy are the strongest adventurers I've ever seen! They're always keeping the people of Idyllshire safe from nasty monsters...or at least they were.

The other day, they went off to hunt something called a “leet mark.” They said they'd be home by sundown, but I haven't seen them since. Miss Zhloe says they probably just got lost. Anyway, I was so scared and lonely all by myself...but then I met Miss Zhloe!

She's been so nice to me, just like a big sister! Sometimes she forgets to unlock the door, or feed us, but I know that's just because she's busy. Right, Miss Zhloe? I just met you, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Miss<Else/>Mister</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, but I like you, too!

Anyway, I'm going to go now. My best friend promised she'd tell me a story about dragons, and I just <Emphasis>love</Emphasis> dragons! See you later, Miss Zhloe, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Miss<Else/>Mister</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>.

That's T'kebbe. Just between the two of us, search parties have been scouring the land for any sign of her parents, but...nothing. I know I shouldn't get the poor girl's hopes up, but I simply haven't the heart to tell her the truth. Besides, Menphina may still work a miracle yet...

The day after her parents disappeared, poor little T'kebbe rushed out from her home to the city gates. She waited there day and night, in the beating rain and blustery wind, just so she could greet her dear mother and father with a smile the very moment they returned home.

When I found her, she was sniffling and shivering in the cold...and that was when my inspiration struck. I would start an orphanage, right here in Idyllshire, and take in all the poor children like T'kebbe who were crying out for a gentle helping hand.
And that's why I must keep to the task! Menphina's Arms must spread wider and wider, that no child need know such pain and loneliness ever again! <rumble> <rumble> Is it supper time yet?

The souvenirs you brought back from Coerthas have been selling like...er, something that sells a whole lot! Master Gegeruju and his friends at Costa del Sol say that just gazing at them is as refreshing as a cool breeze on a hot summer's day!

Why, the gil's been pouring in day and night, left and right! But that's not all! Now that our finances are under control, I can finally buy the books and writing implements I've had my eyes on for so long!

After all, Zhloe can't very well watch over them forever, can she now? I must help them cultivate their minds, that one day they can strike out and earn their keep on their own. Zhloe was never cut out to be more than a humble merchant, but their future is just full of possibilities. I can't let them down!

And to think that not long ago, I was worried that I wouldn't be able to pay next month's rent. Just look at how far we've come! And it's all thanks to you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Zhloe thanks you from the very bottom of her heart!

Today, I think I'll treat myself to a fresh bowl of pineapple pudding! Freshly made three days ago, that is─have to make it last, you know. Anyhow, I know you're doing the hard work, but even I deserve that much, wouldn't you say?
Oh, thank you! The last bowl I had was left over from last month's batch, and it was somewhat lacking in the smoothness one generally associates with pudding. Why, I almost thought I'd crack a tooth!

Not that I <Emphasis>actually</Emphasis> cracked one, of course. See for yourself─Zhloe's smile is as cute as ever! That one tooth that's slightly out of place only adds to the charm! At least, that's what Rowena always told me. Don't you think so, too?
Oh, you're really too sweet! I'll let you in on a secret. From leftover pudding to stale flatbread─no matter how hard a piece of food gets, you can always soften it up by soaking it in hot water!

Of course, it doesn't taste as good then, but at least it's easy on the jaw. And we all have to make sacrifices, right? At least, that's what I tell the children when all I have for their supper is day-old porridge.
<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Oh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! You'll be happy to know that Zhloe's instincts were right on the mark once more!

My contact in Limsa tells me that the materiel you collected for the Maelstrom was─and I quote─“a bloody godssend.” Those were the Admiral's own words! Can you believe it? Zhloe still can't believe it! Every piece has been sold off, and at prices that have our coffers overflowing like never before!

Now I can finally provide the children with the life they deserve. One square meal a day to accompany their usual porridge! Blankets and bedding free of mold and moth holes! Shoes with...<gasp>...actual soles!
And finally─finally!─Zhloe can treat herself to a fresh bowl of pineapple pudding every other day!
What will you say?
Not <Emphasis>every</Emphasis> day?
What will you eat the other day?

Perish the thought, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! How could I even <Emphasis>think</Emphasis> of treating myself to such luxuries when there are children starving in the streets as we speak!? Menphina would never forgive me!

Why...nothing, of course. But don't worry! I just close my eyes, savor the smells wafting in from Adkiragh's kitchen, and chomp my teeth together. If I try <Emphasis>really</Emphasis> hard, I can almost convince myself that I'm dining on a full-course meal!

<If(PlayerParameter(4))>Miss<Else/>Mister</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Miss Zhloe! Thank you so, so, <Emphasis>so</Emphasis> much for the presents! This is my best nameday since the time Mummy and Daddy got me a wind-up moogle!
My best friend was so happy, too! She said it's the second happiest day of her life, after the day she saw a real, live dragon! Did I tell you how much I love dragons?
You certainly did, T'kebbe! And guess what? Zhloe loves dragons, too! But I'm glad your nameday was a happy one. Just wait and see what I have planned for you next year!
Hi Zhloe! I just came to say hi─which I guess I just did! Are you working hard? Khloe's working hard, too!

Oh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! What are you─wait, I know! You're working with Zhloe! Zhloe told me she had a new partner, but I didn't know it was you! Until now, I mean!

Who's this nice-looking <If(PlayerParameter(4))>woman<Else/>man</If>? Is <If(PlayerParameter(4))>she<Else/>he</If> the one helping you with your business? Khloe wishes she had an adventurer helping her, too!

<If(PlayerParameter(4))>She<Else/>He</If> sure is! <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/> here has been a godssend─ever since <If(PlayerParameter(4))>she<Else/>he</If> showed up, the gil's been flowing in virtually nonstop!
That's wonderful, Zhloe! Oh, oh...! Khloe almost forgot! T'kebbe, guess what? Khloe has a new story for you! I think it might be my best ever! You want to hear it, don't you?
Yay! I sure do! Does it have dragons in it? Please say it does!

Anyway, we'll be going now. See you around, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>Miss<Else/>Mister</If> <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! And I know you're really, really busy, Miss Zhloe...but please try not to forget our supper tonight, okay?
So <Emphasis>you're</Emphasis> one of the adventurers who's been sharing your tales with my little sister. No wonder her stories have been so exciting of late!
That was my little sister, Khloe. She just loves telling stories!
She's still just a child, but no matter how hard things get, that smile never leaves her face. Even though I know she's lonely, what with her sister always working.
Now that we're turning a profit and Menphina's Arms is going strong, I can finally spend more time with her. I'm sure she can't wait to tell me her latest stories, and I can't wait to hear them!

But that doesn't mean Zhloe's closing up shop─not for a second! We may be better off than ever before, but there's always more to be done─for the children, of course. You'll still lend me a helping hand from time to time, won't you?

Oh, thank you ever so much, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! Wherever would Zhloe be if it weren't for you? Probably out on the streets, shivering, with nary a bowl of pineapple pudding to be had! Mmm, pineapples...
Thanks to you, we're doing better than we were─at least Zhloe's paying the rent, now!─but I'm afraid to say Menphina's Arms is still a long way from achieving true financial stability.
So Zhloe got to thinking: perhaps we've been doing ourselves a disservice by limiting our dealings to the Ishgardian nobility─no matter how wealthy and generous they might be.

That's why Zhloe's decided to look the realm over, and look <Emphasis>big</Emphasis>! I'm talking about consortiums, cooperatives, and...conspiracies? Commiserations? That doesn't sound right... Anyway! What I'm trying to say is, I've found a promising new client: Master Gegeruju of Gegeruju Shipping!

Have you been to his resort at Costa del Sol, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? They say the sun shines bright on waters clear, every day of every year! Tee hee! That rhymed, didn't it?
Anyway, I had an idea! What sort of rare trinkets and treasures do you think might tickle the fancy of those who live in a world of endless summer?

If you're thinking “cool and refreshing relics from the bleak, blustery highlands of Coerthas,” then I guess great minds think alike! Yes, this is the perfect opportunity to build upon the foundation we've laid! What do you say, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? Are you with me?

Oh, but how far Menphina's Arms has come! From “teetering on the brink of bankruptcy” to “clinging oh-so-desperately to life,” we now find ourselves <Emphasis>this</Emphasis> close to achieving our dream of actual stability! And it's all thanks to you! And me. And our clients, of course. And the children, too! What were we talking about, again?
Oh, that's right! Zhloe's set her sights higher and higher in search of her biggest client yet! You'll never guess who it is!
I'll give you a hint: what begins with a “mmm” sound and rhymes with “aelstrom?” Give up? I'll tell you: the Maelstrom!

A kind regular here at the Hard Place told me that the Admiral's planning to hold a massive war game of sorts. Doesn't that sound fun? And kind of scary. But fun! Anyhow, the word is they're looking for all the equipment they can get their hands on! Cannons, cannonballs...er, more cannons? I have the list around here somewhere...

Anyhow, I'm sure you can see where this is going. If you could procure for me a healthy stock of top-of-the-line naval materiel, I can guarantee you we'll be positively swimming in gil! But hopefully not drowning. Did Zhloe mention that she can't swim?

But where were we? Oh, of course! I've written up a brand new register of items for you to procure. You'll take a look, won't you? Remember, it's not just Zhloe who's counting on you─we must think of the children!

To think Zhloe would live to see the day when Menphina's Arms was finally free of debt! Not that I thought I'd actually <Emphasis>die</Emphasis>, of course. At least, not for a while. I mean, we're all going to die one day, right?

Oh, dear! That conversation took a depressing turn. What I meant to say is, thank you oh so much for all you've done! Thanks to you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, business is thriving, and Zhloe can finally keep Menphina's Arms running on her own!

Oh, T'kebbe! What brings you out here? Is something the matter? Oh, no! Did Zhloe forget your <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>supper<Else/>breakfast</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>lunch<Else/>supper</If></If> again?

<sniffle> N-No, Miss Zhloe. It's...<sniffle>...it's my friend. I told her my nameday was coming, and...she started crying. She said...<sniffle>...she doesn't know when her nameday is. Then I started crying, too.
When I first came to Menphina's Arms, I cried in my bed every night. I tried to smile in front of you, Miss Zhloe, but...but...but deep down, I knew that Mummy and Daddy were never coming back.
But Miss Zhloe was so nice to me, and...and...Khloe would always cheer me up with stories about dragons, and...<sniffle>...before I knew it, I wasn't crying anymore.
And so...so...I want to do for her what Khloe and Miss Zhloe did for me. But what can I do, Miss Zhloe? If only I could give her <Emphasis>my</Emphasis> nameday, I would, but...

Yes, if only...wait! T'kebbe, you're a genius! Don't you see? We'll just declare your nameday the day of <Emphasis>all</Emphasis> your friends who don't have a nameday of their own! We can all celebrate together, and none of you will have to feel alone! That's such a great idea, I wish I'd thought of it! Or wait...did I?
Oh, Miss Zhloe! Can we really? It would make her so, so, happy!

Of course we can! But we're going to need presents! And not just any presents! Presents so delightful that these poor boys and girls will be able to forget...<sniffle>...if only for a day...<sniffle>...all the pain and...<sniffle>...suffering they've endured in their... I'm sorry, I seem to have something in my...<sniffle>...eye...

Get yourself together, Zhloe! Standing around here sniffling isn't going to get anything done! Well now, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, I think you know what we have to do. Are you ready to get collecting?
...Ahem! And with that, I would like to announce our latest client. But before I do, I must warn you─she's quite a demanding one!
Our latest client is none other than...me! Tee hee! Weren't expecting that, were you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? Why, I think I even surprised myself!

Thanks to all you've done, Menphina's Arms have spread wider than I ever dreamed! But there are just a few more things I need to <Emphasis>truly</Emphasis> make my orphanage all I've ever dreamed. I can count on you, can't I?

Zhloe Aliapoh is pleased with your efforts. She now considers you a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Friend to the Orphanage<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>!

Zhloe Aliapoh is delighted with your efforts. She now considers you a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Patron of the Orphanage<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>!

Zhloe Aliapoh is overjoyed with your efforts. She now considers you a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Savior of the Orphanage<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>!

Zhloe Aliapoh could not be happier with your efforts. She now considers you a <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Part of the Family<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>!
And yet there is still much work to be done before the finances of Menphina's Arms are stable. To that end, Zhloe Aliapoh has a new favor to ask of you...
Through your efforts, the finances of Menphina's Arms are now stable. It seems, however, that Zhloe has a different sort of favor to ask of you...

The Custom Deliveries list for Zhloe Aliapoh has been updated. To view the new list, speak with Zhloe and select <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Make a delivery<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
Future requests will be selected at random from all those you have seen thus far, with the list refreshed once a week (Earth time).

You may review the items currently in demand at any time by speaking with Zhloe and selecting <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>Make a delivery<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>.
Note that orphanage donations, rainbow pigment, and river shrimp will earn you particularly handsome rewards. Whenever they make an appearance, the effort to procure them will be worth your while.

Why, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! You've been working your tail off this week, haven't you? Speaking of tails, I really wish the orphan boys would stop pulling mine. Don't they realize how much that hurts?
Anyway, I think you've earned yourself a much-needed rest. Don't go too far, though─Zhloe's counting on you to help keep Menphina's Arms going strong!
Working as hard as ever, I see! Wherever would Zhloe be without you? Out on the street eating stale flatbread and month-old pineapple pudding, that's where!
Still, don't forget to give yourself a rest from time to time! Can I interest you in a bowl of pineapple pudding? <sniff> <sniff> I don't <Emphasis>think</Emphasis> it's rotten yet.
Phew! We outdid ourselves this week, didn't we, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>?

I can't wait to get back to Menphina's Arms and take a nice, long bath. Oh! And I mustn't forget the children's mealtime. Got that, Zhloe? Don't forget to feed the children... Don't forget to feed the children...
Oh dear! Was I talking to myself again? Sorry about that. You take care of yourself, too! And don't forget to feed your children...er, if you have children. You don't have children, do you?
Perfect! This should make a lovely addition to Zhloe's inventory.

I must say, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. I've never seen treasures quite so exquisite as those you've procured for me. Why, you might be the most crafter, gatherer, and fisherer that I've met since...well, ever! Wait, did I just say “fisherer?” That's not a word...is it?

Compared to that, my own skills as a trader leave something to be desired. But is Zhloe going to give up? Not on your life! The children are depending on me! Wait...did I forget to feed them <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>supper<Else/>breakfast</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>lunch<Else/>supper</If></If> again?
Thank you for another batch of lovely treasures, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>!
It's strange. Even though I'm doing the selling and you're doing the crafting, gathering, and, uh, fisherering, I feel like I've learned so much from you!
But there's still so, so much more to learn if I want to be half the trader that Rowena is. That's why I'm so happy that you've promised to keep helping me!

Wait, that wasn't just me talking to myself, right? This may come as a surprise, but I have a tendency to do that from time to time. You <Emphasis>did</Emphasis> promise, didn't you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>?
What will you say?
But of course!
Actually, about that...

Oh, thank you, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! You're such a wonderful role model for me. I'll be watching you closer than ever to see just how I should carry and conduct myself!
Wait! Don't move yet! I'm watching...watching...watching...still watching! Okay, that should do for now. Carry on!
Wh-What!? Y-You're quitting? But why!? Could it be that Zhloe isn't as charming as she thought she was? Impossible! But how, then, to explain your completely inexplicable reaction?

...But of <Emphasis>course</Emphasis>! You must be joking with me! Tee hee! That's the best joke I heard since Adkiragh told me I talk funny. How sweet you all are, always doing whatever you can to keep Zhloe's spirits high!
Thank you oh so much, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Just when I thought you'd done it all, you still manage to amaze me!

But to be honest, sometimes I worry. You've done so much for Zhloe, but what has Zhloe really done for you? I like working with you, but I wouldn't want you to waste your time unless <Emphasis>you</Emphasis> like working with me, too.
You can be honest with Zhloe. She's strong. She can take it. Has our little partnership been as fun and fruitful for you as it has for me?
Oh, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>! You have no idea how happy that makes me! I feel like I could soar high into the heavens on the wings of your words!
Why, I'm so happy I just might treat myself to a fresh bowl of pineapple pudding! Even better, a fresh pineapple! With the skin, leaves, and all!
What will you say?
I don't think that's a good idea...
Um...enjoy?

Heavens, what am I saying!? Forgive me, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Your gesture of admiration so moved me that I got ahead of myself for a moment there. It may surprise you to hear this, but I have a tendency to do that from time to time.
That's strange. You don't look particularly surprised. Anyhow, I look forward to a long and fruitful partnership for many moons to come!

You have delivered the weekly maximum of six items to Zhloe. You may begin making deliveries again starting <ResetTime>1203</ResetTime><Switch(TopLevelParameter(220))><Case(1)>Sunday</Case><Case(2)>Monday</Case><Case(3)>Tuesday</Case><Case(4)>Wednesday</Case><Case(5)>Thursday</Case><Case(6)>Friday</Case><Case(7)>Saturday</Case></Switch> at <If(TopLevelParameter(218))><Switch(TopLevelParameter(218))><Case(1)>1</Case><Case(2)>2</Case><Case(3)>3</Case><Case(4)>4</Case><Case(5)>5</Case><Case(6)>6</Case><Case(7)>7</Case><Case(8)>8</Case><Case(9)>9</Case><Case(10)>10</Case><Case(11)>11</Case><Case(12)>12</Case><Case(13)>1</Case><Case(14)>2</Case><Case(15)>3</Case><Case(16)>4</Case><Case(17)>5</Case><Case(18)>6</Case><Case(19)>7</Case><Case(20)>8</Case><Case(21)>9</Case><Case(22)>10</Case><Case(23)>11</Case></Switch><Else/>12</If> <If(GreaterThanOrEqualTo(TopLevelParameter(218),12))>p.m.<Else/>a.m.</If> (Earth time).
Furthermore, Zhloe Aliapoh's appearance may now be altered through the use of glamours.
